column1: Feeling Dizzy Upon Standing from Blood Pressure Drop

column9: I now have extremely high blood pressure. right now it is 193/93 . I had pacemaker put in May 16,2011. Also have had bifemoral aortic bypass Feb.7,2006. Also have 4 brain anuerysms. 2 were coiled, the other 2 are in such a place coils would not stay.

column1: Feeling Dizzy Upon Standing from Blood Pressure Drop
column2: Ron, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Developed orthostatic hypotension at age 72 after losing 20 pounds post thoracic surgery. Cardiologist prescribed 5mg t.i.d.  Minor improvement in BP but symptoms still limit me to mostly chairborne life.  Dizzy, vision problems, fainting within 2-3 minutes of standing.  Side effects limited to urinary problems, minor chills.

column1: Feeling Dizzy Upon Standing from Blood Pressure Drop
column2: 75 or over Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column1: Other
column2: otowngrl77, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have orthostatic hypotension, but mine causes arrhythmia and vein pain in lieu of fainting (I did faint on the tilt table test). My doctor prescribed this medication to me because he thought my arrhythmia and pain were related to poor blood perfusion due to my hypotension. While Midodrine made my vein pain in my arms go away and my arrhythmia to stop, I developed other symptoms. My legs became numb and the veins in my legs ached on and off. I felt very nauseated and had a headache. As soon as the medication wore off, my original symptoms would return (my legs getting better) with a vengeance and I would have palpitations and my hands turn blue. For me, this medication is NOT the solution to my problem.

column1: Feeling Dizzy Upon Standing from Blood Pressure Drop
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started out at 5 mg t.i.d. with no improvement. Cardiologist upped dose to 10 mg t.i.d. but still no improvement. Last visit, he said midodrine doesn't come in stronger doses & he didn't know what else to do, as he rarely sees orthostatic hypotension in his practice. I am searching for a new cardiologist. Itchy scalp is tolerable, but my eyebrows have mostly disappeared since starting midodrine.

column1: Feeling Dizzy Upon Standing from Blood Pressure Drop
column2: afighter, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have experience blurred vision, itching scalp each that it is taken. I take my med. 10mg 4 x a day on scheduled & 30 minutes before I eat. I join a walking group which I can only walk 20 to 30 minutes before needing to sit down. Before I could not walk or go shopping at all without fainting. I practice deep breathing and yoga exercising. Stress makes my neuropathy condition worst. Drink plenty of water,take B12 and remove Caffine, sugar and msg from your diet. Good Luck! God Bless

column1: Feeling Dizzy Upon Standing from Blood Pressure Drop
column2: doub1963@yahoo.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Ihave POTS and the doctor is constantly changing my meds. I don't drive because my vision is so blurred. The head itching drives me nuts, but I put up with it.I'm now on 15mg of Midrodrine three times a day. I don't seem to be as dizzy or lightheaded as I was, but if I do something like take a shower, cook dinner, vacuum my pressure drops and I always faint or get dizzy enough to lose my balance. I hope over time the meds will help with everyday life. Wishful thinking?

column1: Other
column2: cathywithac3, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i feel like i have a life.  side effects chills, tingles bearable.  after 3 months the pressure in my head wasn't bearable so i started taking 1/2 a pill every 4 hours instead of 1 every eight.  it is effecting my period, on the full dose of 10mg 3 times a day my period stopped completely for 3 months,  on 1/2-4 times a day which means i miss 1 or 2 doses through the night i got my period again. i sleep better not taking a pill right before bedtime.  i still know exactly when it's time for a pill.  i call it the downward spiral. i am so glad there is this pill to take.  it is expensive and that worries me a little. but for now it has made life liveable!

column1: Other
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication for a couple of months now, 4xday, for neurocardiogenic syncope. I hate the scalp itchiness and the cold & clammy feeling off-and-on all day after each dose. It has worked somewhat to reduce the passing out episodes, but in combination with all of the meds I take for other conditions (fibromyalgia, herniated disks, RLS, arthritis), I feel terrible most of the time. During the Tilt Table Test, I passed out and dr. could not find a pulse.... so I take this medication despite the side effects. I go to Cleveland Clinic later this month to a specialist, to see what else can be done.  In the meantime, due to all of the health issues, I am on long-term disability ~ how I miss being productive and I miss the daily interaction with my friends and co-workers, but no way I can work -- after 28 years, I am now a liability because I never know when or where I may pass out on the job. So now I am dealing with depression, too.

column1: Feeling Dizzy Upon Standing from Blood Pressure Drop
column2: stillstanding, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Midodrine 10 mg.for over a year, taking it 3 times daily. Without it I could barely stand/walk long enough to go to the bathroom. Like other reviewers, the itchy scalp drives me crazy. I also wear wigs due to hair loss during chemo, so it can be embarrassing, violently scratching my head in public. The chills are another inconvience-always cold and have to wear a coat to the doctor, movie or shopping. Don't forget the dry mouth. Makes choosing a dinner out a real chore.

column1: Other
column2: scruffy, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I take this medication for vasovagal syncope. Before taking this drug I failed 4 tilt tests within the first 2 minutes (needle stick from the IV triggered the reflex). After taking this drug for three weeks and passing a tilt test, the doctor cleared me to drive again. It's been two years now and I am starting to notice symptoms again, so I expect my doctor will raise the dosage at my next appointment. While I haven't had any side effects, it is a pain to take medication 3 times a day when you are so young. But it beats passing out everytime you have blood drawn (or having a pacemaker)!

column1: Feeling Dizzy Upon Standing from Blood Pressure Drop
column2: Kitt, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with Postural Orthostatic  Tachycardia Syndrome in 1996.  Prior to beginning Midodrine I was bed-ridden and wheel chair bound.  I am now able to stand and walk up to 30 minutes before my blood pressure drops.  Although limited to an altered lifestyle, this medication has kept me from being a burden to family and friends. For more info link to Dysautonomia Information Network.

column1: Feeling Dizzy Upon Standing from Blood Pressure Drop
column2: mereview, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column1: Feeling Dizzy Upon Standing from Blood Pressure Drop
column2: dale92158, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It has stabalized my blood pressure and now I can do things that I could not do for myself just a short time before the medicine was started.  My blood pressure was so dangerously low that I had to be placed in the hospital and monitored 24 hours a day because my pressure was so low.  Now my pressure is staying in a better range and I can stay at home and care for myself instead of being in the CCU at the hospital.  They have had to raise my level of the medicine from 2.5 mgs. twice a day to 5 mgs. three times a day but if that is what we have to do to stabalize my blood pressure so that I feel better I am more than willing to take the three pills a day for that stability.
